poem:
Title: "Vera's Winter Quandary"

From the cosy hubbub of Christmas cheer,  
Her duty calls, Vera must veer.  
On a lonely isle shrouded in ghostly white,  
A tainted star's escape to endless night.  
Muddied prints colour the frost-kissed ground,  
In the silence, four friends are found.  
In Vera's gaze, all secrets bare,  
Dear Santa, what gifts shall they share?
